{{also|Kochen|Köchen}} ==German== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|de|gmh|-}}, from {{inh|de|goh|kochōn}}, {{m|goh|kohhōn||to cook}}, from late {{inh|de|gem-pro|*kukōną||to cook}}, either from {{m|gem-pro|*kukaz||cook}} from Latin {{m|la|coquus}}, or borrowed from {{der|de|VL.|*coco|*coco, cocere}}, from {{der|de|la|coquo|coquō, coquere}}. Compare {{cog|nl|koken}}. More at {{l|en|cook}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/ˈkɔχən/|[-χən]|[-χn̩]|[-χɴ̩]|[-xən]|[-xn̩]|[-xŋ̍]}} * {{audio|de|De-kochen.ogg|Audio}} * {{audio|de|De-at-kochen.ogg|audio (Austria)}} ===Verb=== {{de-verb-weak|kocht|kochte|gekocht}} # {{lb|de|intransitive|of a liquid}} to [[boil]] # {{lb|de|intransitive|of a person}} to [[cook]], to prepare food (chiefly hot food for [[lunch]] or [[supper]]) # {{lb|de|transitive}} to [[boil]] {{gloss|to heat a liquid until it boils}} # {{lb|de|transitive}} to [[boil]] {{gloss|to prepare something in such a liquid}} # {{lb|de|intransitive|figuratively}} to be [[stir up|stirred up]] or [[agitate]]d, especially with [[anger]] ====Usage notes==== * Intransitive {{m|de||kochen}} can be used for all sorts of food preparation that require at least some amount of work and effort. However, there is a strong tendency to use the verb only for the preparation of a proper dinner, be it lunch or supper. Hence, the preparation of, say, an onion tart for dinner is {{m|de||kochen}}, even though the food is baked. Contrarily, the preparation of breakfast is only rarely called {{m|de||kochen}} even if eggs are boiled in the process. * Transitive {{m|de||kochen}} can generally be used only for actual boiling. Hence, {{m|de||ein Steak kochen|t=to cook a steak}} would be understood solely as dropping a steak into a pot of boiling water. ====Conjugation==== {{de-conj-weak|koch|gekocht|h}} ====Synonyms==== * {{sense|of a liquid: to boil}} {{l|de|sieden}} * {{sense|make a liquid boil}} {{l|de|sieden}} * {{sense|prepare food in boiling liquid}} {{l|de|garen}} {{q|broader}} ====Derived terms==== {{der3|de |Kochfeld |abkochen |aufkochen |einkochen |überkochen |verkochen |vorkochen |nachkochen |hart kochen |weich kochen }} ===See also=== * {{l|de|erwärmen}} * {{l|de|erhitzen}} * {{l|de|dampfen}} * {{l|de|qualmen}} * {{l|de|rauchen}} * {{l|de|brodeln}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}} [[Category:de:Cooking]]
